alert.note: Alert for Onondaga; Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Seneca, northwestern Cayuga and southwestern Onondaga Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 445 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Throopsville, or near Auburn, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain will cause reduced visibility while driving. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Auburn, Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Owasco, Sennett, Fleming, Skaneateles and Marcellus. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 near 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
